revised_title: Frequency Dependent Selection in the Molecular Evolution of a Rapidly Evolving Virus
tldr: The author presents a theoretical investigation into inferring frequency dependent selection from the molecular evolution of a rapidly evolving virus, specifically HIV. They use a Monte Carlo simulation to model sequence evolution under selection from the immune system and find that frequency dependent immune selection has a significant effect on viral sequence evolution. The study also discusses the use of drawing inferences about underlying evolutionary processes from samples of viral diversity in infected individuals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Molecular Biology
